Key Match Events: Zack Littell pitched six innings without allowing any runs.
Logan Driscoll hit his first career homer, a two-run shot, in the third inning.
Jonathan Aranda also homered for the Rays, putting them up 3-0.
Jhonkensy Noel and David Fry hit back-to-back doubles in the eighth inning, but their team couldn't score.
Tampa Bay's Edwin Uceta recorded a 1-2-3 ninth inning for his third save.
Post-Match Reflections: Steven Kwan, Cleveland's All-Star left fielder, was scratched from the starting lineup due to body fatigue.
The Guardians' loss narrowed their division lead to three games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zack Littell's performance followed Tampa Bay's bullpen shutting out Cleveland over the final seven innings in Thursday’s series opener.
Logan Driscoll received a warm welcome in Tampa Bay’s dugout as the Rays raised their arms to form a tunnel for him to run through.
The team said Kwan was out with 'body fatigue.' He was sidelined earlier this season with a hamstring injury and has battled hamstring issues throughout his career.
